title: Joliet Body Cam Footage from Carrasco raid

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Joliet Body Cam Footage from Carrasco raid
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

- All body camera footage regarding the execution of a search warrant on the residences of 226 South Comstock Street and 228 Comstock Street on Nov. 2, 2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

title: Ambulance Incident 6-6-22

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ambulance Incident 6-6-22
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Non-exempt audio, video (including body-worn camera, in-car "dash cam", surveillance video, etc), and written reports compiled or obtained by your department related to the response and investigation into the incident below.

Incident: 6/6/22, woman jumps from ambulance and is seriously injured. Location was in the 4200 block of Amelia Olive Branch Road. For reference: https://www.fox19.com/2022/06/07/woman-jumps-ambulance-gets-stuck-under-it-clermont-county-dispatchers-say/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Los Angeles Sheriff's Department - Field Operations Directives

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Los Angeles Sheriff's Department - Field Operations Directives
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking information relating to the following Field Operations Directives (FODs) or Field Operations Support Services (FOSS) newsletters:

89-007 Prosecution of Street Gang Members
89-006 Gang Member Release Policy
10-001 Gang Injunctions
01-003 Proposition 21 Gang Registration
FOSS-21-15 Field Interview Cards

For each of these FOD or FOSS newsletters I am seeking:

1. The date that the new policy was implemented and issued.
2. The date that the old policy that was replaced (if applicable) was first implemented.
2. A copy of the previous policy that was replaced (if applicable) by the current policy in place, including any old copies of the Field Interview cards and when they were discontinued.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Seitz

title: Wytheville Traffic Lights

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Wytheville Traffic Lights
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Several years ago, the Town performed a traffic-pattern/traffic-light study (https://swvatoday.com/wytheville/news/article_515dc2ca-7440-11e5-b22b-6b8b4bed8b8f.html)

I'd like to receive the following information related to it:

1) The costs and documents around selecting the organization performing the study, and performing the study itself.
2) The resultant completed study presumably paid for using tax dollars, including any implementation details and/or alternatives considered.

Pursuant to law, I am a resident of Wytheville, Virginia and my direct FOIA request should be acceptable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert McWhirter

communications.communication:
Dear records officer,

Pursuant to South Carolina Public Records Law, kindly transmit the following records in electronic format on a rolling basis as they are cleared for release:

1) From October 8, 2023 to October 11, 2023: Any emails, including any attachments to said emails, to or from the following individuals...
a. The university Dean(s)
b. The university President
c. The university Chancellor(s)
d. The university Provost(s)
e. The director of university Communications
f. The director of university Alumni Affairs 
...that mention any of the following terms: 
—“Israel"
—“Gaza" 
—“Hamas
—“Palestine"
—“Palestinian"
—"Students for Justice in Palestine"
—“SJP"
—“Chabad
—"Hillel”

If there are any questions about my request, can provide any clarification that will help expedite the processing of my request, please contact me at chaskins@insider.com. I am also happy to hop on the phone.

This FOI request is being filed in pursuit of a time-sensitive news story. Therefore, I ask that my request is expedited. When completing this request, please prioritize whichever records would take the least amount of time to be located and released. I would like these records in electronic format, sent via email or other digital method, and again, please release documents on a rolling basis, as they become available. 

If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Also, I am a member of the news media as a reporter for Business Insider, and the requested documents are in the public interest and not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I ask that all fees are waived in the processing of my request. If fees associated with this request will be in excess of $25, kindly notify me in advance of fulfilling this request. As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is timely, I would appreciate your communicating with me if you have questions regarding this request. 

Thanks again, and I look forward to your reply within 15 business days, as the statute requires, as the statute requires, and an even more prompt reply if you can make a determination without having to review the records in question.

Best,
Caroline Haskins

Pursuant to California Public Records Act, kindly transmit the following records in electronic format on a rolling basis as they are cleared for release:

1) From October 8, 2023 to October 11, 2023: Any emails, including any attachments to said emails, to or from the following individuals...
a. The university Dean(s)
b. The university President
c. The university Chancellor(s)
d. The university Provost(s)
e. The director of university Communications
f. The director of university Alumni Affairs 
...that mention any of the following terms: 
—“Israel"
—“Gaza" 
—“Hamas
—“Palestine"
—“Palestinian"
—"Students for Justice in Palestine"
—“SJP"
—“Chabad
—"Hillel”

If there are any questions about my request, can provide any clarification that will help expedite the processing of my request, please contact me at chaskins@insider.com. I am also happy to hop on the phone.

This FOI request is being filed in pursuit of a time-sensitive news story. Therefore, I ask that my request is expedited. When completing this request, please prioritize whichever records would take the least amount of time to be located and released. I would like these records in electronic format, sent via email or other digital method, and again, please release documents on a rolling basis, as they become available. 

If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Also, I am a member of the news media as a reporter for Business Insider, and the requested documents are in the public interest and not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I ask that all fees are waived in the processing of my request. If fees associated with this request will be in excess of $25, kindly notify me in advance of fulfilling this request. As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is timely, I would appreciate your communicating with me if you have questions regarding this request. 

Thanks again, and I look forward to your reply within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires, as the statute requires, and an even more prompt reply if you can make a determination without having to review the records in question.

Best,
Caroline Haskins
